creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. W. John Driscoll
provenance:
(M. Knoedler and Company, New York, New York by 1883); purchased by James J. Hill [1838-1916], St. Paul, Minnesota on August 1, 1883;[1] by descent to his daughter Charlotte Hill Slade [d. 1923]; by descent to her son George Norman Slade [b. 1902]; by descent to his daughter Elizabeth Slade Driscoll and W. John Driscoll [b. 1930], St. Paul, Minnesota; gift to MIA in 1980.

[1] According to Hill's ledger, the work was purchased for $750.00 as "Turn of the Tide" (inventory no. 30; Hill voucher no. 49).
title: Frame, formerly on Trost-Richards, "Quiet Seascape"
